messages: 28e2307e1643c3378ae21fa68a1cef63 (02:05): Hi, I have an input box and a submit button to the left of it. I want to change the order so that the submit button comes to the right but not sure what's the best way to do it, any hint on how to mirror it on place?
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:10): CSS isn't great for changing the order of elements
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:10): my first guess would be to float:right both of the elements
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:10): but then you'd end up with everything on the right
6239f0a4eb71a025df48cd9b32ad7a84 (02:10): gareth: you are a beautiful man
28e2307e1643c3378ae21fa68a1cef63 (02:28): GarethAdams: yes this is the problem really
28e2307e1643c3378ae21fa68a1cef63 (02:30): GarethAdams: I think I found a way by using direction: rtl;
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:32): Does FireFox have issues with div background images?
28e2307e1643c3378ae21fa68a1cef63 (02:34): Shariff: may be you can give an example to test
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:35): Hang on.. I just messed something up :D
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:38): http://trilista.highmage.net/test.html
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:38): with IE it shows a background picture that is a bar on the top and left side (1 pic).. in FF it doesn't show that image
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:46): edgy> Any clues?
28e2307e1643c3378ae21fa68a1cef63 (02:47): Shariff: just a couple of mins please
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:49): your problem is that IE doesn't use background-attachment:fixed properly
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:49): your other problem is using tables for layout
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:50): so you and Microsoft are 1-1 at the moment
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:51): Well interestinly enough.. IE does show the picture where FF does not
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:51): In this case (only in this case) I like IE :)
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:51): that doesn't make it right
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:51): it just makes your interpretation as wrong as IEs ;)
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:52): actually, I'm not convinced that's the whole problem
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:52): but I'm not digging through unnecessary tables to find out :P
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:53): Ok.. I appearently got more problems
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:53): But what I hope to find out is.. how do I make it work :)
28e2307e1643c3378ae21fa68a1cef63 (02:54): Shariff:  I don't know why FF won't display it!
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:54): Shariff: I like that - looking at the big picture ;)
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:55): unfortunately you'll need to rearrange most of that HTML
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:55): And yeah.. I use 1 table for layout :D
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:55): that will include removing about half of it though, so it's actually a bonus
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:56): Ok.. sorry for being such a noob.. but can you be a bit more specific?
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:56): i am not getting a clear understanding of what is wrong, or a hint what to do to make it work :)
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:56): uh, ignore me
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:57): Rather not, if you have an idea what's wrong :D
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:57): but you'll have to remove the table bits of the layout
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:57): not "most of it"
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:58): keep the contents though
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:58): Don't really care about that content, yet :)
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:58): What I'm trying to do is correct someone else's mistakes
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:58): http://www.gammafleet.net/trilista/
28e2307e1643c3378ae21fa68a1cef63 (02:59): Shariff: then use css to render image borders
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:59): Is a page that holds a frame with 5 pages linked
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:59): I'm trying to solve the mess created from that page :)
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (02:59): I'm primarely concerned with the layout of the site not the content just yet :)
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:00): first concern, then, is whether it need to look the same as the old site, or whether that old look is barf-worthy
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:00): I'll give you 2 guesses
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (03:00): Oh definately the 2nd!
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (03:01): The project is horrible
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (03:01): the management is worse
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (03:01): 4 people work on that very site, everyone of them has even less knowledge than I do :)
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (03:01): That's why I first want a clear structure (which is lacking) to procede from there
28e2307e1643c3378ae21fa68a1cef63 (03:04): Shariff: try first to remove that word fixed and I guess it would work for you
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:04): well firstly, remove the word 'fixed'
bc061e0e2ca567fd3e1cb6792cf4bfc6 (03:05): how do I make it so a text element in a form can't be modified?
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:05): existance: depends why
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:05): do you still want the field submitted with the for,?
bc061e0e2ca567fd3e1cb6792cf4bfc6 (03:06): GarethAdams, it doesn't need to be submitted
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:06): you could argus that is should be in a <div> then - <input> is for, well, inputting
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:06): but <input disabled="disabled"> will work
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (03:07): You guys are brilliant!
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:07): you should use the div if all you're worried about is how it looks - that can be corrected with CSS
28e2307e1643c3378ae21fa68a1cef63 (03:07): Shariff: you are the first to confirm that I know something that someone in the world doesn't know ;)
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (03:08): the background directives in css are also moved when you use a div's padding?
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:09): see, they shouldn't
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:09): I couldn't work out why they were either
28e2307e1643c3378ae21fa68a1cef63 (03:12): Shariff: sorry you mean you want the background to be fixed or what?
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:13): edgy: adding padding-left to the div with the background actually moves the background too :-/
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (03:14): What GarethAdams said :)
28e2307e1643c3378ae21fa68a1cef63 (03:14): GarethAdams: and why is this strange? which class are you adding padding to?
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:14): divMain
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:15): I've closed the window now
28e2307e1643c3378ae21fa68a1cef63 (03:16): GarethAdams: Shariff should just add a padding-left to "p" class to move the text only
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (03:16): Then I would do a margin-left...
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:16): padding shouldn't move the background
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (03:16): But then I need to do that with every class/id within that div
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (03:17): I though so too..
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:17): remove 'top' from your background CSS rule
28e2307e1643c3378ae21fa68a1cef63 (03:17): Shariff: no just do p { padding-left: 20px}
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:17): as well as fixed
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:17): then the padding-left will work fine
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (03:18): basically, that 'top' is short for 'top center'
9f784624eb74e08bda5b3a25988a2735 (03:18): Again brilliant :D
1995f89f9a61d75acd0d00c8fbc96481 (03:39): is it possible to check the resolution of the viewer of my page? and display a different background for different resolutions?
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (03:40): MetaPhaze_laptop, only with javascript, and its non-standard so there's no way to ensure that the browser does in fact provide that information
1995f89f9a61d75acd0d00c8fbc96481 (03:40): Zeros, so it's not practical
